nodes.name: project
nodes.description: Any specifically defined piece of work that is undertaken or attempted to meet a single requirement. (NCIt C47885)

properties.name: availability_mechanism
properties.description: Mechanism by which the project will be made available.

properties.name: availability_type
properties.description: Is the project open or restricted?

properties.name: code
properties.description: Unique identifier for the project.

properties.name: complete
properties.description: Description of whether the project submission is complete or still in progress.

properties.name: date_collected
properties.description: The date or date range in which the project data was collected.

properties.name: dbgap_accession_number
properties.description: The dbgap accession number provided for the project.

properties.name: intended_release_date
properties.description: Tracks a Project's intended release date.

properties.name: investigator_affiliation
properties.description: The investigator's affiliation with respect to a research institution.

properties.name: investigator_name
properties.description: Name of the principal investigator for the project.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Unique name for the project.

properties.name: project_sponsor
properties.description: The name of an agency, institution, consortium, or other body that oversees the projects and resources. For academic programs that center around a lab or individual use the department or consortium name.

properties.name: project_sponsor_other
properties.description: If "Other" is selected in the previous field, type the project sponsor name.

properties.name: project_sponsor_type
properties.description: Type of sponsor organization.

properties.name: project_sponsor_type_other
properties.description: If "Other" is selected in the previous field, type of sponsor organization.

properties.name: project_url
properties.description: Link to project website.

properties.name: releasable
properties.description: A project can only be released by the user when `releasable` is true.

properties.name: released
properties.description: To release a project is to tell the GDC to include all submitted entities in the next GDC index.

properties.name: short_name
properties.description: Project name abbreviation or short name, unique ID.

properties.name: support_id
properties.description: The ID of the source providing support/grant resources.

properties.name: support_source
properties.description: The name of source providing support/grant resources.

properties.name: project.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'project' table.

properties.name: full_citation
properties.description: Full citation

properties.name: link
properties.description: GEO Accession link for project level data

properties.name: title
properties.description: Title of the publication

properties.name: project.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'project' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'publication' table.

properties.name: publication.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'publication' table.

nodes.name: resource
nodes.description: A collection of data or resources, can have files attached or may point to an external reference

properties.name: access_type
properties.description: Type of resource access provided.

properties.name: description
properties.description: A text description of the resource.

properties.name: domain
properties.description: Subject domain of the resource, broad categories.

properties.name: domain_other
properties.description: If "Other" is selected in previous field, type the domain name.

properties.name: is_static
properties.description: Check yes if the data are static or no if the resource is expected to be updated in the future.

properties.name: keywords
properties.description: Enter keywords that describe the resource, preferably from controlled vocabulary, glossary, or MESH.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of resource, typically project name.

properties.name: payment_required
properties.description: Indicate whether resource is free or fee based

properties.name: publication_links
properties.description: Link to corresponding publication(s).

properties.name: publications
properties.description: A citation and related link to a resource publication (# - preferred data field)

properties.name: resource_id
properties.description: Internal identifier.

properties.name: resource_reference
properties.description: Enter reference details for citing the resource in a publication (# - preferred data).

properties.name: resource_reference_link
properties.description: URL to online information about how to cite the resource.

properties.name: resource_type
properties.description: Type of resource, should match template type.

properties.name: resource_url
properties.description: resource website

properties.name: resource_use_agreement
properties.description: If agreement terms for using the resource are given, copy the exact terms here (# - preferred data).

properties.name: resource_use_agreement_link
properties.description: URL to online information about requirements/conditions for using the resource.

properties.name: short_name
properties.description: Resource name abbreviation, typically project_short_name.

properties.name: verification_datetime
properties.description: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm]

properties.name: project.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'project' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'resource' table.

properties.name: resource.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'resource' table.

nodes.name: geospatial_data_resource
nodes.description: A collection of geospatial data or resources, can have files attached or may point to an external reference

properties.name: comments
properties.description: Notes on usage of the data, including warnings.

properties.name: data_formats
properties.description: Select the format(s) of data in the collection (# - preferred data).

properties.name: data_link
properties.description: URL to online location where data can be downloaded

properties.name: data_location_text
properties.description: A list of locations for data files, such as a ftp site, an Amazon S3 bucket, or a URL.

properties.name: display_type
properties.description: Display type of resource

properties.name: exposure_media
properties.description: Media to which the phenomena is related.

properties.name: geographic_feature
properties.description: The type of geographic feature associated with the data.

properties.name: geographic_feature_other
properties.description: If "Other" was selected in the previous field, enter the type of geographic feature associated with the data.

properties.name: geometry_source
properties.description: Source or provider of the geometry data.

properties.name: geometry_source_other
properties.description: If "Other" was selected in the previous field, enter the geometry source here.

properties.name: geometry_type
properties.description: Type of geometric data, the file extension will be different for different types (# - preferred data).

properties.name: has_api
properties.description: Flag indicating whether or not resource has an api.

properties.name: has_visualization_tool
properties.description: Flag indicating whether or not resource has visualization tool(s).

properties.name: includes_citizen_collected
properties.description: Flag indicating whether or not resource includes citizen science.

properties.name: intended_use
properties.description: Brief narrative about how the data can be used in research projects, could include references to good data uses.

properties.name: measurement_method
properties.description: Method used to capture the measures.

properties.name: measurement_method_other
properties.description: If "Other" is selected in previous field, enter the method used to capture the measure.

properties.name: measures
properties.description: Enter list of specific variables collected by the resource system. If the variables are part of a set of variables, then enter the set name, e.g., clinical labs for clinical laboratory tests (especially if the specific labs vary from individual to individual), or VOC if for a list of volatile organic chemicals. Copy measure terms from measure_list worksheet.

properties.name: measures_other
properties.description: If terms are not included in the measue_list worksheet, enter them here.

properties.name: measures_parent_category
properties.description: type of environmental phenomena being observed at the parent concept level

properties.name: measures_subcategory_major
properties.description: type of environmental phenomena being observed at the subcategory level

properties.name: measures_subcategory_minor
properties.description: type of environmental phenomena being observed at the subcategory level

properties.name: model_methods
properties.description: If data are modeled, describe modeling method(s) used to generate the data.

properties.name: model_methods_other
properties.description: If "Other" is selected in the previous field, enter the name of the modeling method used.

properties.name: source_name
properties.description: Name of the primary data source if not generated by this resource (# - preferred data).

properties.name: spatial_bounding_box
properties.description: Boundary coordinates for the geographical region (should be included in the model spatial metadata).

properties.name: spatial_coverage
properties.description: Maximum spatial coverage of the data, if specific regions list in next field.

properties.name: spatial_coverage_other
properties.description: If "Other" is selected in previous field, enter the specific region covered here; avoid using special symbols following same convention as in spatial_resolution_other (e.g., convert 40° to 40 degrees.). Do not convert latitude, longitude pairs if given as decimal.

properties.name: spatial_resolution
properties.description: The finest spatial resolution of the data. If there are multiple resources and determining the highest spatial resolution is impractical, use "Other".

properties.name: spatial_resolution_other
properties.description: If "Other" is selected in previous field, enter the finest spatial resolution of the data. May be a specific distance measure (e.g., '5 km’, ‘2 degrees’, and ‘2 degrees by 5 degrees’). Convert 40° 11.25′ to 40 degrees, 11 arc min, 25 arc sec.

properties.name: temporal_resolution
properties.description: The finest available temporal resolution (i.e., highest frequency, finest scale) from CV (# - preferred data).

properties.name: temporal_resolution_other
properties.description: If "Other" is selected in the previous field, enter the finest temporal resolution here.

properties.name: time_available_comment
properties.description: Description of the time extent details if multiple times exist in the resource or if there are discontinuities over time.

properties.name: time_extent_end_yyyy
properties.description: Four digit year (YYYY)

properties.name: time_extent_start_yyyy
properties.description: Four digit year (YYYY)

properties.name: update_frequency
properties.description: Frequency of data resource update (# - preferred data)

properties.name: update_frequency_other
properties.description: If "Other" is selected in previous field, enter the frequency here.

properties.name: resource.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'resource' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'geospatial_data_resource' table.

properties.name: geospatial_data_resource.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'geospatial_data_resource' table.

nodes.name: geospatial_tool_resource
nodes.description: A tool for dealing with geospatial data

properties.name: comments
properties.description: Optional submitter comment

properties.name: display_type
properties.description: Display type of resource

properties.name: intended_use
properties.description: Brief description of how the data can be used in research projects, could include references to good data uses.

properties.name: is_open
properties.description: Is the tool open source?

properties.name: languages
properties.description: List the programming languages in which the tools is written.

properties.name: languages_other
properties.description: If "Other" was selected in previous field, enter the programming languages in which the tool(s) is written.

properties.name: license_type
properties.description: Type of license needed for use of software.

properties.name: license_type_other
properties.description: If "Other" is selected in previous field, enter the type of license needed for use of software.

properties.name: operating_system
properties.description: Type of operating system on which the tool runs.

properties.name: operating_system_other
properties.description: If "Other" is selected in previous field, enter the type of system on which the tool runs.

properties.name: suggested_audience
properties.description: suggested audience to use this tool

properties.name: tool_type
properties.description: Type of tool.

properties.name: tool_type_other
properties.description: If "Other" is selected in the previous field, enter the tool type here.

properties.name: resource.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'resource' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'geospatial_tool_resource' table.

properties.name: geospatial_tool_resource.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'geospatial_tool_resource' table.

nodes.name: key_data_resource
nodes.description: A key dataset for climate and health

properties.name: comments
properties.description: Notes on usage of the data, including warnings.

properties.name: data_formats
properties.description: Format of data download files (# - preferred data)

properties.name: data_link
properties.description: URL to online location where data can be downloaded.

properties.name: data_location_text
properties.description: Location(s) where data files are downloaded, e.g., ftp site, Amazon S3 bucket (# - preferred data).

properties.name: display_type
properties.description: Display type of resource

properties.name: exposure_media
properties.description: The media to which the phenomena is related.

properties.name: geographic_feature
properties.description: The type of geographic feature associated with the data.

properties.name: geographic_feature_other
properties.description: If "Other" is selected in the previous field, enter the type of geographic feature associated with the data.

properties.name: geometry_source
properties.description: Source or provider of the geometry data.

properties.name: geometry_source_other
properties.description: If "Other" is selected in the previous field, enter the geometry source here.

properties.name: geometry_type
properties.description: Type of geometric data, the file extension will be different for different types (# - preferred data).

properties.name: has_api
properties.description: Flag indicating whether or not resource has an api.

properties.name: has_visualization_tool
properties.description: Flag indicating whether or not resource has visualization tool(s).

properties.name: includes_citizen_collected
properties.description: Flag indicating whether or not resource includes citizen science.

properties.name: intended_use
properties.description: Suggested, intended, or applied uses for dataset in environmental health research. This is drawn from the example applications and review of documentation from the data providers on the intended uses.

properties.name: license_type
properties.description: License needed for using the dataset.

properties.name: license_type_other
properties.description: If "Other" is selected in the previous field, enter the type of license needed to use the dataset.

properties.name: measurement_method
properties.description: Method used to capture the data measurements.

properties.name: measurement_method_other
properties.description: If "Other" is selected in the previous field, enter the method used to capture the data measurements.

properties.name: measures
properties.description: List of specific variables collected by the system. If the variables are part of a set of variables then the set name can be provided, e.g., clinical labs for clinical laboratory tests especially if the specific labs vary from individual to individual, or VOC for a list of volatile organic chemicals. Copy measure terms from 'measure_list file'.

properties.name: measures_other
properties.description: If term is not in 'measures_list file' e.g., not part of VOC, enter it here for discussion with others about incorporation into VOC.

properties.name: measures_parent_category
properties.description: type of environmental phenomena being observed at the parent concept level

properties.name: measures_subcategory_major
properties.description: type of environmental phenomena being observed at the subcategory level

properties.name: measures_subcategory_minor
properties.description: type of environmental phenomena being observed at the subcategory level

properties.name: model_methods
properties.description: If data are modeled, description of modeling approaches used to generate them.

properties.name: model_methods_other
properties.description: If "Other" is selected in the previous field, enter the data modelling method(s) here.

properties.name: source_name
properties.description: Name of the primary data source if not generated by this resource (# - preferred data).

properties.name: spatial_bounding_box
properties.description: Boundary coordinates for the geographical region (should be included in the model spatial metadata).

properties.name: spatial_coverage
properties.description: Maximum spatial coverage of the data; if specific regions, list in next field below

properties.name: spatial_resolution
properties.description: The finest spatial resolution of the data. If there are multiple resources and determining the finest spatial resolution is impractical, use "Other".

properties.name: spatial_resolution_all_available
properties.description: All available horizontal spatial resolutions of the dataset, such as 1-km grid or ZIP codes, from CV. Use "Other" for spatial resolutions not included in the CV.

properties.name: spatial_resolution_all_other_available
properties.description: If "Other" is selected in the previous field, enter all other spatial resolutions not in CV, such as value and unit of measure, e.g., 50 km, 1 degree, 0.75 sq. km.

properties.name: spatial_resolution_comment
properties.description: Any other relevant details describing the spatial resolution of the dataset, such as variable spatial resolution (e.g., nested grids), or grids with less common geometry (hexagonal grid, 0.5 degree x 0.625 degree, etc.).

properties.name: spatial_resolution_other
properties.description: If "Other" is selected in the previous field, enter the finest spatial resolution of the dataset. It may be a specific distance measure (e.g., '5 km’, ‘2 degrees’, ‘2 degrees by 5 degrees’). Convert resolutions like 40 deg. 11.25 min. to 40 degrees, 11 arc min, 25 arc sec.

properties.name: temporal_resolution
properties.description: The finest available temporal resolution (i.e., highest frequency, finest scale) from CV (# - preferred data).

properties.name: temporal_resolution_all_available
properties.description: All available temporal resolutions (i.e., scale or frequency) of the dataset, such as daily or annual, selected from a CV.

properties.name: temporal_resolution_all_other_available
properties.description: If "Other" is selected in the previous field, enter all other temporal resolutions for the dataset.

properties.name: temporal_resolution_comment
properties.description: Description of the time extent details if multiple times exist in the resource or if there are discontinuities over time.

properties.name: temporal_resolution_other
properties.description: If "Other" is selected in the previous field, enter the the temporal resolution here, e.g., one year daily average.

properties.name: time_available_comment
properties.description: Description of the time extent details if multiple times exist in the resource or if there are discontinuities over time.

properties.name: time_extent_end_yyyy
properties.description: Four digit year (YYYY)

properties.name: time_extent_start_yyyy
properties.description: Four digit year (YYYY)

properties.name: update_frequency
properties.description: Frequency of data resource update (# - preferred data).

properties.name: update_frequency_other
properties.description: If "Other" is selected in previous field, enter the frequency here.

properties.name: use_example_application_link
properties.description: The URL corresponding to each example application to document specific data use (if available) and/or the homepage.

properties.name: use_example_application_text
properties.description: Examples of applications (e.g., health cohorts) that have used the dataset and are the basis for the example uses, metrics, and key variables. (# - preferred data).

properties.name: use_example_metrics
properties.description: Example metrics derived from example applications, that can be calculated using the dataset to assess individuals' (e.g., patients, health cohort participants) environmental exposures based on geocoded addresses and time period of exposure.

properties.name: use_limitations
properties.description: Key limitations or restrictions for the suggested use(s).

properties.name: use_strengths
properties.description: Key strengths of the dataset for the suggested use(s).

properties.name: use_suggested
properties.description: Suggested, intended, or applied use(s) in environmental and public health research based on example use applications and the data-provider's documentation on intended uses. (# = preferred).

properties.name: use_suggested_other
properties.description: If "Other" is selected in the previous field, enter the suggested use(s) here.

properties.name: resource.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'resource' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'key_data_resource' table.

properties.name: key_data_resource.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'key_data_resource' table.

properties.name: biospecimens
properties.description: Were human biospecimens collected?

properties.name: biospecimens_type
properties.description: Select type(s) of biospecimen(s) collected.

properties.name: data_formats

nodes.name: supplementary_file
nodes.description: Supplementary files associated with a study.

properties.name: data_category
properties.description: The text term describing the broad category that the supplementary file falls into.

properties.name: data_format
properties.description: The text term describing the file format of the supplementary file, for example, PDF, XLSX, JPEG, PNG, TSV, etc.

properties.name: data_type
properties.description: The type of supplementary file, for example, figures, tables, clinical data, notes, publications, summary statistics, etc.

properties.name: file_description
properties.description: Free text to expand upon details for this file

properties.name: file_name
properties.description: The name (or part of a name) of a file (of any type).

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: The size of the data file (object) in bytes.

properties.name: md5sum
properties.description: The 128-bit hash value expressed as a 32 digit hexadecimal number used as a file's digital fingerprint.

properties.name: object_id
properties.description: The GUID of the object in the index service.

properties.name: storage_urls
properties.description: A list of URLs where the file is stored in the cloud.

properties.name: geospatial_data_resource.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'geospatial_data_resource' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'supplementary_file' table.

properties.name: population_data_resource.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'population_data_resource' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'supplementary_file' table.

properties.name: geospatial_tool_resource.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'geospatial_tool_resource' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'supplementary_file' table.

properties.name: key_data_resource.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'key_data_resource' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'supplementary_file' table.

properties.name: supplementary_file.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'supplementary_file' table.
